subtlest.description: Used for subtle, supporting text elements. Example- breadcrumbs, placeholder text in input fields, helper text, other minor interface details.

subtle.description: Used for supplementary information that supports primary content, such as captions, subheadings, or descriptions.

default.description: Use for primary text, such as body copy, sentence case headers, and buttons.

inverse.description: Main text color and inverse of other text colours used on light backgrounds. Used on dark backgrounds, such as in buttons, modals, and dark-themed components.

warning.description: Used for cautionary or warning text, such as 'Pending Approval,' 'Pending' tags, alert banners, tooltips, and inline warnings, to highlight actions or statuses that require attention.

success.description: Used for text indicating a favorable outcome, such as success messages in input fields, verified information, and tags like 'Approved' or 'Completed.'

error.description: Used for critical text elements, such as error messages in input fields and status tags like 'Declined' or 'Pending Update,' to highlight important actions or alerts requiring user attention.

default.description: Used across the product to reinforce brand identity, Ex- CTA Text, primary buttons, navigation elements, Primary icons. Illustrations for brand should also be made using this as the main colour.

disabled.description: Used for text elements that are inactive or unavailable, such as disabled buttons, form fields, and input labels. This color is applied to indicate non-interactive states, ensuring users can easily distinguish between active and inactive elements.

error.description: Should only be used with 'Error Text'

info.description: Should only be used with 'Info Text'

warning.description: Should only be used with 'Warning Text'

success.description: Should only be used with 'Success Text'

default.description: The standard state for icons, used for active or visible elements, such as navigation or status icons. Icons can only be paired up with 'Text Default'

icon-inverse.description: Used for icons on dark backgrounds or dark-themed components, as inverse of the darker colours.

subtlest.description: Applied to icons that represent background or minimal actions. Icons can only be paired up with 'Text Subtlest'

subtle.description: Used for icons that need to be less prominent, such as secondary actions or less important information, without detracting from primary content. Icons can only be paired up with 'Text Subtle'

disabled.description: Used for icons that are inactive or unavailable. Used with 'Disabled Text'

default.description: The standard stroke used with light background components. Ex-input fields, modals, cards and more.

bold.description: The stroke used when a component needs to be subtly highlighted

inverse.description: The inverse of the stroke colour used with dark backgrounds

error.description: Stroke used when displaying error in an input field

default.description: Used for the overall background of the page or screen, providing a neutral and unobtrusive foundation for content.

flat-white.description: Used as a background for fields, cards, modals, pop ups

error.description: Used as a background for chips, labels, banner and tags for showcasing Error

info.description: Used as a background for chips, labels, banner and tags  for showcasing Information

warning.description: Used as a background for chips, labels, banner and tags for showcasing Warning

success.description: Used as a background for chips, labels, banner and tags for showcasing Success

default.description: Used for background as a brand colour in special cases

subtle.description: Used as a lighter subtle colour for background in the family of brand colour

subtlest.description: Used as a minimal colour when showcasing colours for background in the same family as brand colour

disabled.description: Used as the colour for disabled background

blanket~scrim.description: Used as a blanket screen, behind Modals and pop ups

hover.description: Used to indicate a 'prefilled hover state' in an input field
